Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Madison Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-SB (School District No. 2) -- 5.27 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition 
(School District No. 2)
(School Support Renewal Tax)

Summary:  Authority to renew a 10 year, 5.27 mills property tax for the purpose of giving additional aid and support to public elementary and secondary schools in Madison Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall School District No. 2 of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized under the authority conferred by Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, the applicable provisions of Chapter 5, Chapter 6-A and Chapter 6-B of Title 18 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, to levy a five and twenty-seven hundredths (5.27) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $557,720 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of giving additional aid and support to public elementary and secondary schools in Madison Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Mills) -- 1 Mill - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Millage)

Summary:  10 year 1 mill property tax for providing, operating, maintaining and supporting a public transportation service for the residents of Madison Parish, including the acquisition of vehicles and equipment to provide such service.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a one (1) mill tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $106,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of providing, operating, maintaining and supporting a public transportation service for the residents of the Parish, including the acquisition of vehicles and equipment to provide such service?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Vets) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Madison Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Madison Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Richmond -- $790,000 Bond - Mayor & BOA - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Village of Richmond Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $790,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation Bonds of the Village of Richmond for the purpose of constructing, overlaying, paving and improving public streets, including incidental drainage, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Richmond, State of Louisiana (the "Village"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Seven Hundred Ninety Thousand Dollars ($790,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding six per centum (6%) per annum, to be sold at par, for the purpose of constructing, overlaying, paving and improving public streets, including incidental drainage, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the Village and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated fifteen mills (15) to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said bonds?
